description: This course introduces students to the history and art of ancient Italy, focusing on the
city of Rome and the Bay of Naples (Pompeii) area. It covers more than 1000 years of civilization,
beginning with the Etruscans and ending with the fall of the Western Roman Empire. When not
visiting museums and archaeological sites, students have the opportunity to experience
modern Italian culture as well. Offered during January term in alternate years.  Apply through
